DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Postoperative Complete Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator to determine whether an MRI was completed after surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.:Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a post-op MRI completed within 3 weeks after diagnostic surgery for GBM and have images available for upload into TRIAD?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a post-op MRI completed within 3 weeks after diagnostic surgery for GBM and are images available for upload into TRIAD OR If the post-op MRI has not yet been completed as of the date of study registration, will the post-op MRI be completed within 3 weeks after diagnostic surgery for GBM?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a post-op MRI completed within 3 weeks after diagnostic surgery for GBM and are images available for upload into TRIAD?

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
